6// FrameBufferMtl.h:
7// Defines the class interface for FrameBufferMtl, implementing FrameBufferImpl.
8//
9
10#ifndef LIBANGLE_RENDERER_METAL_FRAMEBUFFERMTL_H_
11#define LIBANGLE_RENDERER_METAL_FRAMEBUFFERMTL_H_
12
13#import <Metal/Metal.h>
14
15#include "libANGLE/renderer/FramebufferImpl.h"
16#include "libANGLE/renderer/metal/RenderTargetMtl.h"
17#include "libANGLE/renderer/metal/mtl_render_utils.h"
18
19namespace rx
20{
21namespace mtl
22{
23class RenderCommandEncoder;
24} // namespace mtl
25class ContextMtl;
26class SurfaceMtl;
27
28class FramebufferMtl : public FramebufferImpl
29{
30 public:
31 explicit FramebufferMtl(const gl::FramebufferState &state,
32 bool flipY,
33 WindowSurfaceMtl *backbuffer);
34 ~FramebufferMtl() override;
35 void destroy(const gl::Context *context) override;
36
37 angle::Result discard(const gl::Context *context,
38 size_t count,
39 const GLenum *attachments) override;
40 angle::Result invalidate(const gl::Context *context,
41 size_t count,
42 const GLenum *attachments) override;
43 angle::Result invalidateSub(const gl::Context *context,
44 size_t count,
45 const GLenum *attachments,
46 const gl::Rectangle &area) override;
47
48 angle::Result clear(const gl::Context *context, GLbitfield mask) override;
49 angle::Result clearBufferfv(const gl::Context *context,
50 GLenum buffer,
51 GLint drawbuffer,
52 const GLfloat *values) override;
53 angle::Result clearBufferuiv(const gl::Context *context,
54 GLenum buffer,
55 GLint drawbuffer,
56 const GLuint *values) override;
57 angle::Result clearBufferiv(const gl::Context *context,
58 GLenum buffer,
59 GLint drawbuffer,
60 const GLint *values) override;
61 angle::Result clearBufferfi(const gl::Context *context,
62 GLenum buffer,
63 GLint drawbuffer,
64 GLfloat depth,
65 GLint stencil) override;
66
67 const gl::InternalFormat &getImplementationColorReadFormat(
68 const gl::Context *context) const override;
69 angle::Result readPixels(const gl::Context *context,
70 const gl::Rectangle &area,
71 GLenum format,
72 GLenum type,
73 const gl::PixelPackState &pack,
74 gl::Buffer *packBuffer,
75 void *pixels) override;
76
77 angle::Result blit(const gl::Context *context,
78 const gl::Rectangle &sourceArea,
79 const gl::Rectangle &destArea,
80 GLbitfield mask,
81 GLenum filter) override;
82
83 bool checkStatus(const gl::Context *context) const override;
84
85 angle::Result syncState(const gl::Context *context,
86 GLenum binding,
87 const gl::Framebuffer::DirtyBits &dirtyBits,
88 gl::Command command) override;
89
90 angle::Result getSamplePosition(const gl::Context *context,
91 size_t index,
92 GLfloat *xy) const override;
93
94 RenderTargetMtl *getColorReadRenderTarget(const gl::Context *context) const;
95 RenderTargetMtl *getDepthRenderTarget() const { return mDepthRenderTarget; }
96 RenderTargetMtl *getStencilRenderTarget() const { return mStencilRenderTarget; }
97
98 bool flipY() const { return mFlipY; }
99
100 gl::Rectangle getCompleteRenderArea() const;
101 int getSamples() const;
102 WindowSurfaceMtl *getAttachedBackbuffer() const { return mBackbuffer; }
103
104 bool renderPassHasStarted(ContextMtl *contextMtl) const;
105 mtl::RenderCommandEncoder *ensureRenderPassStarted(const gl::Context *context);
106
107 // Call this to notify FramebufferMtl whenever its render pass has started.
108 void onStartedDrawingToFrameBuffer(const gl::Context *context);
109 void onFrameEnd(const gl::Context *context);
110
111 // The actual area will be adjusted based on framebuffer flipping property.
112 gl::Rectangle getCorrectFlippedReadArea(const gl::Context *context,
113 const gl::Rectangle &glArea) const;
114
115 // NOTE: this method doesn't do the flipping of area. Caller must do it if needed before
116 // callling this. See getReadPixelsArea().
117 angle::Result readPixelsImpl(const gl::Context *context,
118 const gl::Rectangle &area,
119 const PackPixelsParams &packPixelsParams,
120 const RenderTargetMtl *renderTarget,
121 uint8_t *pixels) const;
122
123 private:
124 void reset();
125 bool checkPackedDepthStencilAttachment() const;
126 angle::Result invalidateImpl(ContextMtl *contextMtl, size_t count, const GLenum *attachments);
127 angle::Result blitWithDraw(const gl::Context *context,
128 FramebufferMtl *srcFrameBuffer,
129 bool blitColorBuffer,
130 bool blitDepthBuffer,
131 bool blitStencilBuffer,
132 GLenum filter,
133 const mtl::BlitParams &baseParams);
134 angle::Result clearImpl(const gl::Context *context,
135 gl::DrawBufferMask clearColorBuffers,
136 mtl::ClearRectParams *clearOpts);
137
138 angle::Result clearWithLoadOp(const gl::Context *context,
139 gl::DrawBufferMask clearColorBuffers,
140 const mtl::ClearRectParams &clearOpts);
141
142 angle::Result clearWithLoadOpRenderPassNotStarted(const gl::Context *context,
143 gl::DrawBufferMask clearColorBuffers,
144 const mtl::ClearRectParams &clearOpts);
145
146 angle::Result clearWithLoadOpRenderPassStarted(const gl::Context *context,
147 gl::DrawBufferMask clearColorBuffers,
148 const mtl::ClearRectParams &clearOpts,
149 mtl::RenderCommandEncoder *encoder);
150
151 angle::Result clearWithDraw(const gl::Context *context,
152 gl::DrawBufferMask clearColorBuffers,
153 const mtl::ClearRectParams &clearOpts);
154
155 // Initialize load store options for a render pass's first start (i.e. not render pass resuming
156 // from interruptions such as those caused by a conversion compute pass)
157 void setLoadStoreActionOnRenderPassFirstStart(mtl::RenderPassAttachmentDesc *attachmentOut, const bool forceDepthStencilMultisampleLoad);
158
159 // Fill RenderPassDesc with relevant attachment's info from GL front end.
160 angle::Result prepareRenderPass(const gl::Context *context, mtl::RenderPassDesc *descOut);
161
162 // Check if a render pass specified by the given RenderPassDesc has started or not, if not this
163 // method will start the render pass and return its render encoder.
164 mtl::RenderCommandEncoder *ensureRenderPassStarted(const gl::Context *context,
165 const mtl::RenderPassDesc &desc);
166
167 void overrideClearColor(const mtl::TextureRef &texture,
168 MTLClearColor clearColor,
169 MTLClearColor *colorOut);
170
171 angle::Result updateColorRenderTarget(const gl::Context *context, size_t colorIndexGL);
172 angle::Result updateDepthRenderTarget(const gl::Context *context);
173 angle::Result updateStencilRenderTarget(const gl::Context *context);
174 angle::Result updateCachedRenderTarget(const gl::Context *context,
175 const gl::FramebufferAttachment *attachment,
176 RenderTargetMtl **cachedRenderTarget);
177
178 // This function either returns the render target's texture itself if the texture is readable
179 // or create a copy of that texture that is readable if not. This function is typically used
180 // for packed depth stencil where reading stencil requires a stencil view. However if a texture
181 // has both render target, pixel format view & shader readable usage flags, there will be
182 // some glitches happen in Metal framework.
183 // So the solution is creating a depth stencil texture without pixel format view flag but has
184 // render target flag, then during blitting process, this texture is copied to another
185 // intermidiate texture having pixel format view flag, but not render target flag.
186 angle::Result getReadableViewForRenderTarget(const gl::Context *context,
187 const RenderTargetMtl &rtt,
188 const gl::Rectangle &readArea,
189 mtl::TextureRef *readableDepthView,
190 mtl::TextureRef *readableStencilView,
191 uint32_t *readableViewLevel,
192 uint32_t *readableViewLayer,
193 gl::Rectangle *readableViewArea);
194
195 angle::Result readPixelsToPBO(const gl::Context *context,
196 const gl::Rectangle &area,
197 const PackPixelsParams &packPixelsParams,
198 const RenderTargetMtl *renderTarget) const;
199
200 angle::Result readPixelsToBuffer(const gl::Context *context,
201 const gl::Rectangle &area,
202 const RenderTargetMtl *renderTarget,
203 bool reverseRowOrder,
204 const angle::Format &dstAngleFormat,
205 uint32_t dstBufferOffset,
206 uint32_t dstBufferRowPitch,
207 const mtl::BufferRef *dstBuffer) const;
208
209 RenderTargetMtl * getColorReadRenderTargetNoCache(const gl::Context *context) const;
210
211 // NOTE: we cannot use RenderTargetCache here because it doesn't support separate
212 // depth & stencil attachments as of now. Separate depth & stencil could be useful to
213 // save spaces on iOS devices. See doc/PackedDepthStencilSupport.md.
214 std::array<RenderTargetMtl *, mtl::kMaxRenderTargets> mColorRenderTargets;
215 RenderTargetMtl *mDepthRenderTarget = nullptr;
216 RenderTargetMtl *mStencilRenderTarget = nullptr;
217 mtl::RenderPassDesc mRenderPassDesc;
218
219 const mtl::Format *mRenderPassFirstColorAttachmentFormat = nullptr;
220 bool mRenderPassAttachmentsSameColorType = false;
221
222 // Flag indicating the render pass start is a clean start or a resume from interruption such
223 // as by a compute pass.
224 bool mRenderPassCleanStart = false;
225
226 WindowSurfaceMtl *mBackbuffer = nullptr;
227 const bool mFlipY = false;
228
229 mtl::BufferRef mReadPixelBuffer;
230};
231} // namespace rx
232
233#endif /* LIBANGLE_RENDERER_METAL_FRAMEBUFFERMTL_H */
234
